author: GameSpot
description:
Veteran voice actors Ray Chase, Max Mittleman, and Robbie Daymond of Sassy Chap Games discuss their debut project "Date Everything". Aside from pushing the Dating Sim genre to its natural, hilarious conclusion, the game also envisions a deeply complex community that exists within the confines of the player's home that they discover as they build their own relationships with everything from the refrigerator to their long neglected athletic equipment.

0:00 - Game Launch Excitement
1:00 - AI Replacement Plot Hook
2:20 - The Writing Process
4:09 - Playing the Toilet Character
5:50 - Comedy with Heart
7:34 - Sandbox Gameplay & Branching Paths
10:48 - Replayability and Character Depth
13:12 - Organic Storytelling
16:04 - Kindness Tokens and Stakes
17:03 - Realistic Dating Sim
19:18 - Player Character & Inclusivity
21:28 - Yeti Fandom & Merch

#DateEverything #Gamespot #DevInterview #Interview #summergamefest2025
title: "Date Everything" Explores the Social Dynamics Between All the Stuff in Your House

author: GameSpot

author: GameSpot
description: Crimson Desert showed up at Summer Games Fest 2025 with a new build of Crimson Desert, branching out slightly from the combat arena focus, and more into completing a whole mission. There were more abilities, more mechanics shown off, and some setting adjustments that put our minds at ease.
title: Everything I learned From My Second Hands-On With Crimson Desert
